systemStatus.title: System Status
systemStatus.subtitle: QUICK CATCH UP YOUR DEVICE STATUS.

power.title: Power
power.subtitle: Power Settings
power.description: This section enables you to dynamically adjust thermal performance and maximize the battery life. It also has other popular power-related features. You can check the default settings in this section and customize your system according to your needs.

powerSmartSettings.title: Power Smart Settings
powerSmartSettings.subtitle: INTELLIGENT COOLING
powerSmartSettings.description1: This feature dynamically adjusts thermal settings to your needs. When on, it adjusts settings to keep the device cooler or quiet, while being held or idle. Otherwise, it optimizes performance while the device is on a stable surface. When off, you can manually set thermal priority.
powerSmartSettings.description2: Intelligent Cooling adjusts fan speed, maximum surface temperature and performance. This feature has below modes and are now accessible by Windows performance power slider.

readMore.line1: Quiet mode: Slider is far left. The fan speed and performance are lowered for a cooler, quieter computer and best battery life.
readMore.line2: Balanced mode: Slider is in the center. Fan speed and performance are dynamically balanced for the best experience.
readMore.line3: Performance mode: Slider is far right. Fan speed and permissible surface temperature are higher for maximum performance.

alwaysUSB.title: Always on USB
alwaysUSB.description: Charge USB devices through the Always on USB connector on the computer, when the computer is in sleep, hibernation, or off mode. A smartphone or tablet can be charged quickly from the USB connector that is yellow-coded or silk-printed with these icons:
alwaysUSB.checkbox: Enable USB charging from laptop battery when computer is off.

easyResume.title: Easy Resume
easyResume.description: Enable this feature to improve your resume time if you frequently open and close your computer's lid.
easyResume.tooltip: This feature will improve your resume time if you frequently open and close your computer’s lid. When enabled, your computer will enter a low power mode when you close its lid, but it will resume instantly if you reopen your lid within 15 minutes of closing it. This feature also allows your notebook to attempt to finish pending activities (such as sending email or downloading a file) before the system goes into suspend.

vantageToolbar.title: Lenovo Vantage Toolbar
vantageToolbar.description: Pin Vantage Toolbar to the Windows task bar to easily get more battery details and access to your quick settings.

airPlanePower.title: Airplane Power Mode
airPlanePower.description: Protect the airplane AC power outlet by controlling the power consumption of your system. When Airplane Power Mode is enabled, the computer reduces power consumption by limiting the battery charging rate and system performance.

batteryThreshold.title: Battery Charge Threshold
batteryThreshold.description: If you primarily use your computer with the AC adapter attached and only infrequently use battery power, you can increase the lifespan of the battery by setting the maximum charge value to below 100%. This is useful because batteries that are used infrequently have a longer lifespan when they are maintained at less than a full charge.
batteryThreshold.tooltip: If your battery is currently charged above the stop-charging threshold, detach the power until the battery discharges to or below the stop-charging threshold. Depending on the battery status (old or new), the exact point at which the charging starts or stops might vary by up to 2 percentage points. If you enable the feature, it is recommended that you perform a Battery Gauge Reset occasionally to ensure an accurate report of the battery health.

popup.title: Enable Battery Charge Threshold
popup.description: Enabling a custom battery charge will allow for the overall battery health to last longer as you use this device. However, not having a full charge will allow less runtime battery life. In order to fully enable this feature, please unplug your machine and allow your battery to drain to or below the stop-charging threshold.

expressCharging.title: Express Charging
expressCharging.description: Express Charge allows your battery to a full charge much faster than normal mode.
expressCharging.tooltip: Express Charge allows you to charge your system battery much faster but this may reduce the lifetime of the battery.

conservationMode.title: Conservation Mode
conservationMode.description:
This function is useful to extend the lifespan of your battery when plugged.
When this mode is enabled, the battery will only be charged to 55-60% of capacity and the battery lifespan can be maximized. However, this will shorten the time you use your computer after it is disconnected from the AC power source.

tooltip.line1: This function is useful to extend the lifespan of your battery when plugged.
tooltip.line2: When this mode is enabled, the battery will only be charged to 55-60% of capacity and the battery lifespan can be maximized. However, this will shorten the time you use your computer after it is disconnected from the AC power source.
tooltip.line3: Note: Express Charging and Conservation mode cannot work at the same time. IF one of the modes is turned on, the other one will be automatically turned off.

audio.title: Audio
audio.subtitle: Audio Settings
audio.description: This section enables you to automatically optimize or fully configure your audio settings manually, such as Dolby settings, microphone, etc.

audioSmartsettings.title: Audio Smart settings
audioSmartsettings.subtitle: APPLICATION-BASED SETTINGS
audioSmartsettings.description: Automatically adjust audio settings according to different apps you are using.

microphone.title: Microphone
microphone.tooltip: You can customize your MIC effect by adjusting the microphone volume and specify appropriate mode.

volume.title: Microphone Volume
volume.description: Dolby Audio delivers rich, clear, powerful sound from all the content you enjoy, select appropriate mode for your content and equipment.

suppress.title: Suppress keyboard noise
suppress.tooltip: Toggle this on to optimize the MIC audio by suppressing keyboard noise.

acoustic.title: Acoustic Echo Cancellation
acoustic.tooltip: Toggle on this feature to optimize your MIC audio by reducing acoustic echo.

optimize.title: Optimize my microphone for:
optimize.tooltip: Configure microphone effect to enhance your audio experience by different scenarios and environment.

displayCamera.title: Display & Camera
displayCamera.subtitle: Display & Camera Settings
displayCamera.description: This section enables you to improve your visual experience and configure your camera properties. Explore more features and customize your display experience here.

eyeCareMode.title: Eye Care Mode
eyeCareMode.checkbox: Schedule eye care mode from sunset to sunrise
eyeCareMode.tooltip: Eye Care Mode adjusts the color temperature of your display to filter out blue light and reduce eye strain.

camera.title: Camera
camera.note: Note: Lenovo Vantage does not have permissions to access your camera. Please turn on access to your camera for the Lenovo Vantage app.

cameraPrivacy.title: Camera privacy mode
cameraPrivacy.tooltip: The camera stops sending live images when the privacy setting is enabled. Turn this setting on, only when you do not want to share your images to others while video calling.

camera.title: Camera
camera.tooltip: Click here to reset Camera properties to default settings.

popup.rebootForceMsg: The update(s) you selected will cause the system to reboot automatically after installation.
popup.shutdownForceMsg: The update(s) you selected will cause the system to shut down automatically after installation.
popup.rebootDelayedMsg: The update(s) you selected will cause the system to reboot after installation, during the installation of updates, please do not turn off your system, remove power source or accessories. We recommend saving your work in preparation for your system rebooting.
popup.rebootRequiredMsg: In order to successfully install the updates your computer needs a reboot to ensure everything is running safe and smoothly.

critical.title: Critical Updates
critical.tooltip: Critical updates can prevent significant problem, major malfunctions, hardware failure, or data corruption.

camera.title: Camera
camera.tooltip: Click here to reset Camera properties to default settings.

banner.title: An up-to-date system is a healthy system.
banner.next: Next updated scan is scheduled on
banner.description: These packages include updates to hardware drivers and other system utilities that are critical for the correct operation of your computer. Critical updates are also important for protecting data on your computer and should be installed as they become available. Failure to install these packages could result in data loss, system malfunction, or hardware failure.

fail.title: Some updates were not installed correctly.
fail.description: Something went wrong during the downloading or installation of these updates. Please make sure you are online and don't turn off computer when installing these updates.

warranty.subDescription1: This product has years limited warranty and it entitled to depot repair service. Customers may call their local service center for more information. Dealers may provide carry-in repair for this product.
warranty.subDescription2: We were unable to locate warranty details for your device, to have more warranty options, please visit our support website.

needHelp.title: Need Help?
needHelp.description: CONTACT US TO HELP YOU OUT.

quicklinks.title: Quicklinks
quicklinks.description: CONTACT US TO HELP YOU OUT.

landing.notFullyDesc: You are not fully protected. Learn how to better protect yourself now.
landing.maliciousNetwork: Prevented your computer from joining {{maliciousWifi}} malicious networks this month.

common.title: Anti-Virus
common.recommends: Lenovo recommends McAfee to protect all your devices with:
common.award: Award winning protection from the latest online threats including ransomware and malware
common.dedicated: Dedicated security that consistently outperforms Defender and other leading AV providers
common.deviceToCloud: Device to cloud technology that won't slow down your PC
common.privacyTerms: Read more on the <tag>Privacy Policy</tag> and <tag>Terms of Service</tag>
common.betterProtected: .However, you could be better protected with McAfee LifeSafe

windowsDefender.subtitle: You are currently being protected by Windows Defender.However, you could be better protected with McAfee LiveSafe. Learn more below.
windowsDefender.windowsSubtitle: Windows defender offers basic protection for your device

mcafee.title: McAfee LiveSafe
mcafee.subtitle: You are currently protected by McAfee LiveSafe
mcafee.awardSubtitle: Blocks viruses, malware, ransomware, spyware, unwanted program and more on your PC.
mcafee.encryptedSubtitle: Keep sensitive files private by storing them on your PC with 128-bit encryption.
mcafee.identitySubtitle: Take charge of protecting your identity from theft and fraud.
mcafee.supportSubtitle: Has you covered by phone, by chat, or online for the life of your subscription.
mcafee.antiSubtitle: Blocks dangerous messages before they reach your inbox by removing emails that may include risky links and viruses.
mcafee.virusSubtitle: Provides you with the confidence that in the event your PC gets a virus, a McAfee expert will remotely access your computer to remove it.
mcafee.parentalSubtitle: Block web sites and search results you don’t want your kids to see. Also lets you set limits for how much time they spend online.

others.othersProtection: offers you basic protection for your device

container.title: Lenovo Wifi Security
container.name: WIFI SECURITY
container.disableDecribe: Lenovo WiFi Security is an advanced cloud-based software service that helps your device differentiate safe wireless networks from potentially malicious ones.

threatlocator.describe: Use the threat detector to determine the safety of the networks around you.

locationmodal.title: Enable location services
locationmodal.describe1: To use Lenovo WiFi Security, you need to enable location services for Lenovo Vantage. Would you like to enable location now?
locationmodal.describe2: To use Connected Home Security, you need to enable location services for Lenovo Vantage. Would you like to enable location now?

homesecurity.title: Connected Home Security
homesecurity.titleDescription: Connected Home Security keeps you safe in three ways:
homesecurity.homeSecurityAffect1: Connected Home Security ensures your device is safe, and has not been compromised
homesecurity.homeSecurityAffect2: Connected Home Security ensures that the networks you are connected to are safe
homesecurity.homeSecurityAffect3: Connected Home Security ensures that other devices connected to your home network are safe.
homesecurity.describe: Unsafe devices and networks can introduce malware, lead to identity theft, and leak private and financial information. Enable this feature to reduce the risk of having your device, and your home network exposed to attackers
homesecurity.subtitle: Peace of Mind
homesecurity.subtitleDescribe: Connected Home Security will send you an alert if it detects a vulnerability in your device or home network, or if you are connected to a potentially malicious network. Learn even more in about Connected Home Security in Tips and Tricks.

invitationcode.buttonDescribe: You have already joined this device to an existing Connected Home Security account.
invitationcode.title: Already have Connected Home Security?
invitationcode.titleDescribe: Please ensure location permissions are enabled for Vantage in order to add your device to an existing Connected Home Account, and to use Connected Home Security.
invitationcode.canUse: You can now start using Connected Home Security

securityhealth.title: Security Health
securityhealth.learnMoreAboutSecurityHealth: Learn more about each of these components <tag>here</tag>.
securityhealth.peaceOfMind: Do you want more peace of mind?

vpn.title: VPN Security
vpn.whatIsSufEasy: SurfEasy is a VPN, or Virtual Private Network provider that helps protect you while you are surfing the internet. Without a VPN, your PC may be more vulnerable to attackers and identity thieves. A VPN runs silently in the background and provides additional safety and privacy measures while you use the internet.
vpn.whatCanSufEasy1: A Virtual Private Network provider helps you protect while you are surfing the internet. Without a VPN, your PC may be more vulnerable to attackers and identity thieves. A VPN runs silently in the background and provides safety and privacy measures.
vpn.whySufEasyDescription: SurfEasy makes it easy to stay safe while surfing the internet. It helps you remain anonymous, and adds an additional layer of security between you and anyone that wants your personal information.
vpn.startUseSufEasy1: Using a VPN adds Security. SurfEasy encrypts your data, adding anonymity and security.
vpn.startUseSufEasy2: Once registered SurfEasy runs silently in the background so everything runs the same but better.
vpn.startUseSufEasy3: Start using SurfEasy to protect yourself while browsing the internet. Enjoy the no-log VPN that works on every device.
vpn.startUseSufEasy4: As a surfEasy user enjoy 250 MB of free data every 30 days! Unlock additional data by following the steps on the "Rewards" tab of the SurfEasy app.
vpn.whatCanSufEasy2: A VPN provider helps to protect you while you are surfing the internet. Without a VPN, our PC may be more vulnerable to attackers and identity thieves. A VPN runs silently in the background and provides safety and privacy measures.
vpn.getStarted1: After installing SurfEasy, register and make an account.
vpn.getStarted2: Log in with your secure credentials.
vpn.getStarted3: Wait for confirmation to know you are connected, and then begin browsing securely.
vpn.howToGetData2: Add second device and earn +250 Mb
vpn.howToGetData3: Refer a friend and earn +500 MB
vpn.howToGetData4: Like SurfEasy on Facebook and earn +100 MB
vpn.howToGetData5: Follow SurfEasy on Twitter and earn +100 MB
vpn.privacyPolicyAndTermsOfService: Read more on the <tag>Privacy Policy</tag> and <tag>Terms of Service</tag>

passwordManager.title: Password Health
passwordManager.whatIsPmNotInstalled: The safest, easiest way to save strong, complex passwords and log in instantly on every site.
passwordManager.whatIsPmInstalled: A safer digital life is waiting: Add passwords, enable Dark Web Monitoring and autofill personal and payment info.
passwordManager.startProtect: Start protecting your online accounts the simple way.
passwordManager.learnMoreAbout: <tag>Learn more</tag> about making the most of Dashlane
passwordManager.whatIsDashLane: Dashlane is a password manager and digital protection app that works with your browser. It automatically saves passwords and personal data, remembers it all for you, and stores everything securely. Dashlane also analyzes your account security and provides easy ways to improve your password health.
passwordManager.helpYou2: Log in instantly everywhere for seamless browsing
passwordManager.helpYou3: Sync across devices so you're never without access to important accounts
passwordManager.helpYou4: Improve your online protection with easy, actionable advice
passwordManager.checkOutThisGuide: Use Dashlane to stay safe online while saving time and frustration. For detailed instructions on how to get started, <tag>check out this guide.</tag>
passwordManager.allowsYou1: Log in instantly every where for seamless Browsing-Sync across devices so you're never without access to important accounts
passwordManager.allowsYou2: Monitor the dark web for your personal information
passwordManager.allowsYou3: Stay safe on unsecured WiFi networks with built in VPN
passwordManager.allowsYou4: Share passwords securely without revealing them
passwordManager.privacyPolicyAndTermsOfService: Read more on the <tag>Privacy Policy</tag> and <tag>Terms of Service</tag>

windowsHello.title: Windows Hello
windowsHello.protectYourDevice: Protect your device with these Lenovo recommended security options.
windowsHello.signIn: Sign in quickly and securely with Windows Hello.
windowsHello.whyWindowsHelloDescription1: Windows Hello makes logging into your PC easier and more secure, and can also be used for your online Microsoft apps. Follow the instructions below to begin using Windows Hello.
windowsHello.visitAndRegister: Visit the Windows Hello page and register your fingerprint.
windowsHello.visitInSettings: <tag> Visit Windows Hello</tag> in system settings
windowsHello.unlock: Use Windows Hello to log into and unlock your PC with a touch of a finger on the sensor.
windowsHello.startUsingWindowsHello: Start using Windows Hello to log into Microsoft Apps such as Outlook, OneDrive, Office 365 and Xbox Live.
windowsHello.whyWindowsHelloDescription2: Windows Hello makes logging into your PC easier and more secure. And you can also be used for your online Microsoft apps. Follow the instructions below to begin using Windows Hello
windowsHello.traditional: Traditional passwords can be stolen and used to access your account from anywhere in the world. More secure and convenient. Windows Hello is the next generation of a password. Use your fingerprint reader [or IR camera] instead of insecure passwords to log in.
windowsHello.howToStart: How do I start using Windows Hello?

lenovoId.ssoErrorCommon: Oops, we’ve encountered an error. Please try again.
lenovoId.ssoErrorTimeStampIncorrect: Oops, looks like your PC time is incorrect. Please correct the time on your PC and try again.
lenovoId.ssoErrorNetworkDisconnected: Oops! Connection failed! Please check your Internet connection and try again.
lenovoId.ssoErrorCommunicating: Network error. Please check your connection and try again.
lenovoId.ssoErrorAccountPluginNotExist: Plug-in missing. We will restore the plug-in in the background automatically if you are connected to the internet. This may take some time, please try again later.

footer.title: Not finding what you are looking for?
footer.description: NEED ADDITIONAL SUPPORT? DON’T HESITATE TO CONTACT US VIA:

question1.title: Back up and restore your files
question1.para1: It's always good to have a backup. Keep copies of your files on another drive in case something happens to the originals.
question1.para2: Select the Start button, select Settings > Update & security > Backup > Add a drive , and then choose an external drive or network location for your backups.
question1.para3: All set. Every hour, we'll back up everything in your user folder (C:\Users\username). To change which files get backed up or how often backups happen, go to More options.
question1.para4: If you're missing an important file or folder, here's how to get it back:
bulletset1: 1. Type Restore files in the search box on the taskbar, and then select Restore your files with File History.
2. Look for the file you need, then use the arrows to see all its versions

3. When you find the version you want, select Restore to save it in its original location. To save it in a different place, press and hold (or right-click) Restore, select Restore to, and then choose a new location.

question2.title: How to refresh your PC
question2.para1: If your PC isn't performing as well as it once did, and you don't know why, you can refresh your PC without deleting any of your personal files or changing your settings. Windows can “refresh” your PC so it’s more like a fresh install without deleting your personal files.
question2.para2: Refresh your PC, Here is what will happen: your files and personalized settings won’t change
bulletset1: Your PC settings will be changed back to its defaults
Apps from windows store will be kept
Apps you installed from disc or website will be removed
A list of removed files will be saved on your desktop
bulletset2: Tap or click Update and recovery
Under Refresh your PC without affecting your files, tap or click Get started.
Click "Refresh" to start the refresh process.
Once the refresh process is done, you can find a Removed Apps list on the desktop
You can find the removed apps while refreshing your system
bulletset3: Search for refresh in the search tool available in the Start menu
Click on "Refresh your PC without affecting your files" in the search results as shown below.
Click on the Get started button just below the heading "Refresh your PC without affecting your files" to start refreshing your Windows 10 PC.
question2.para7: In most cases, once you start to refresh your PC, it’ll finish on its own. However, if Windows needs missing files, you’ll be asked to insert recovery media, which is typically a DVD disc or thumb drive. If that happens, what you’ll need depends on your PC.
question2.para8: If you upgraded your PC to Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1 with a DVD, use that disc. If you don’t have Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1 media, contact Microsoft Support.

question3.title: How to know your machine's CPU
question3.para1: The terms 32-bit and 64-bit refer to the way a computer's processor (also called a CPU), handles information. The 64-bit version of Windows handles large amounts of random access memory (RAM) more effectively than a 32-bit system.
question3.para2: The above symptom is associated with, but not limited to, the following systems:
bulletset1: Open System by clicking the Start button Picture of the Start button, right-clicking Computer, and then clicking Properties
Under System, you can view the system type.
bulletset2: Method 1: View the System window in Control Panel
Swipe in from the right edge of the screen, and then tap Search. Or, if you are using a mouse, point to the lower-right corner of the screen, and then click Search.
Type system in the search box, and then tap or click Settings.

If you are running a 64-bit version of Windows 8, 64-bit Operating System is displayed in the System type field under the System heading. If you are running a 32-bit version of Windows 8, 32-bit Operating System is displayed in the System type field under the System heading.
Method 2: View the System Information window
Swipe in from the right edge of the screen, and then tap Search. Or, if you are using a mouse, point to the lower-right corner of the screen, and then click Search.
In the search box, type system information
Tap or click System, tap or click System Information, and then click System Summary.
If you are running a 64-bit version of Windows 8, x64-based PC is displayed in the System type field under the Item heading.
question3.para7: If you are running a 32-bit version of Windows 8, x86-based PC is displayed in the System type field under the Item heading.

question4.title: Check your machine's battery use
question4.para1: Windows 10 includes a new “Battery Use” screen that shows you what’s draining your laptop’s juice. That means it’ll tell you exactly what apps–both desktop and Windows 10 “universal” apps–are using too much power.
question4.para5: This feature is new in Windows 10, we need to find this feature first as it is not stored in your traditional control panel view, this feature is located in the new “Settings” app
bulletset1: A. Find the Battery Use Screen
1. Click or Tap the “Settings” option from the start menu
2. In Settings select “System”and then select “Battery saver.”
3. Click or tap the “Battery use” link under this heading to see more details.
B. Analyze Your Power Usage
4. You can change to make the battery use screen to display battery use from last 24 hours to last 48 hours or last from last week
5. “System,” “Display,” and “Wi-Fi” percentages. This shows how much battery power has been used by system processes, the display,
6. The “In use” and “Background” options show how much power is used by applications while you’re using them, compared to applications running in the background.

7. If apps are using power in the background, you can click or tap the “Change background app settings” link and configure apps to not run in the background. This only works for universal Windows 10 apps.

8. Scroll down further and you will see a list of applications, this is considered as the most useful section of this feature. It will display a list of the apps have used battery power in that period, and show you what percentage of your battery power each app has used

question5.title: Use your PC like a tablet
question5.para1: Tablet mode makes Windows more intuitive and easier to use when you have a touchscreen device.
question5.para2: To turn on tablet mode, select action center on the taskbar, then select Tablet mode.
question5.para3: To find out if your device can automatically turn on tablet mode, search for your device on the manufacturer's website. Support for this feature depends on the hardware, the driver that's installed, and how the device was set up by the manufacturer.
question5.para4: In tablet mode, apps open full screen, giving you more space to work. To close an app, drag it to the bottom of the screen.
question5.para5: The taskbar is available when your PC is in tablet mode, but you can hide it if you want more room on the screen. Select the Start button, select Settings > System > Tablet mode , then turn on Automatically hide the taskbar in tablet mode. To see the hidden taskbar, swipe up from the bottom of the screen, or use your mouse to hover there.
question5.para6: To use two apps side by side in tablet mode, drag an open app down and to the side. You'll see where it'll snap, and you'll see any open apps next to it.
question5.para7: In this view, you can also:
bulletset1: Use the shared edge between two snapped apps to resize both apps at the same time.
Open a new app from task view—select Task view on the taskbar, select an app, then drag it to one side to snap it into your divided screen.
Use the back button on the taskbar to go back in an app, or to open an app that you were using before.

question6.title: Get to know Cortona, your personal assistant
question6.para1: Cortana is your digital agent. She'll help you get things done.
question6.para2: The more you use Cortana, the more personalized your experience will be.
question6.para3: To get started, type a question in the search box, or select the microphone  and talk to Cortana. (Typing works for all types of PCs, but you need a mic to talk.)
question6.para4: If you’re not sure what to say, you’ll see suggestions on your lock screen, and in Cortana home when you select the search box on the taskbar.
question6.para6: Here are some things Cortana can do for you:
bulletset1: Use the shared edge between two snapped apps to resize both apps at the same time.
Open a new app from task view—select Task view on the taskbar, select an app, then drag it to one side to snap it into your divided screen.
Use the back button on the taskbar to go back in an app, or to open an app that you were using before.
question6.para7: One of the things Cortana can do is to give you reminders. She can remind you to do things based on time, places, or even people.
question6.para8: For example, type or say, “Remind me to congratulate Tanya the next time she calls.”
question6.para9: The reminder will appear when you get a call from Tanya.
question6.para10: Extra bonus—if you have a Windows phone or Cortana for iPhone or Android, you can set Cortana to sync notifications between your PC and phone.
question6.para11: Set Cortana to hear you anytime you say “Hey Cortana.” Select the search box on the taskbar to open Cortana home. Then select Settings  and turn on Let Cortana respond to “Hey Cortana.”
question6.para13: Cortana is only available in certain countries/regions, and some Cortana features might not be available everywhere.
